params.name: options
params.doc: Options for sorting, filtering, paging, and specifying return fields.

docs.summary: Returns a list of posts by query.
description:
Paging
- limit: default - 10, min - 0, max - 100
- offset: default - 0, min - 0

Filterable fields:
- id
- categoryId
- ownerId
- title
- contentText
- bestAnswerCommentId
- pinned
- commentingEnabled
- commentCount
- likeCount
- viewCount
- createdDate
- editedDate
- lastActivityDate
- slug

Sortable fields:
- lastActivityDate
- createdDate
- commentCount
- viewCount
- likeCount
- pinned

examples.title: queryPosts example for dashboard page code
queryPosts example for exporting from backend code

members.name: reactionIdentities
members.doc: List of reacted identities grouped by reaction code.

members.name: postId
members.doc: ID of the post to delete.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: extraFields
members.doc:
Array of extra post fields to be included in the response.

Supported values: `"IMAGES"`, `"VIDEOS"`, `"URL"`, `"REACTION_IDENTITIES"`.

members.name: extraFields
members.doc:
Array of extra post fields to be included in the response.

Supported values: `"IMAGES"`, `"VIDEOS"`, `"URL"`, `"REACTION_IDENTITIES"`.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has logged in to the site.

members.name: wixUserId
members.doc: ID of a Wix user (site owner, contributor, etc.).

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has logged in to the site.

members.name: wixUserId
members.doc: ID of a Wix user (site owner, contributor, etc.).

members.name: identity
members.doc: The identification type and identity data.

members.name: expiresInMinutes
members.doc: The amount of minutes after which the pin will be removed (unpinned)

members.name: expiresInMinutes
members.doc: The amount of minutes after which the pin will be removed (unpinned)

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: Category ID the post is listed under.

members.name: closed
members.doc: Whether post is closed and commenting is disabled.

members.name: commentInteraction
members.doc:
Defines what interactions may be applied on the comment under the post.

Supported values: `"REACTION"`, `"VOTE"`.

members.name: contentText
members.doc: The post content in plain text.

members.name: lastActivityDate
members.doc: Date of latest activity on this post. For example, date the latest comment was added to post.

members.name: markedComments
members.doc: IDs of the marked comments for this post (selected by forum admin or post owner).

members.name: pinned
members.doc: Whether the post is pinned. Places the post at the top of the post list.

members.name: reactionIdentities
members.doc: List of reaction identities grouped by reaction code.

members.name: recentActivity
members.doc: Recent activity of post. For example, a comment added to a post.

members.name: extraFields
members.doc: Array of extra post fields to be added in the response.

members.name: post
members.doc: Post for the provided post ID.

members.name: extraFields
members.doc: Array of extra post fields to be added in the response.

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc:
Records can be sorted by:
lastActivityDate
createdDate
commentCount
viewCount
likeCount
isPinned

members.name: order
members.doc: Records can be sorted in ascending (default) or descending order.

members.name: extraFields
members.doc:
Array of extra post fields to be included in the response.

Supported values: `"IMAGES"`, `"VIDEOS"`, `"URL"`, `"REACTION_IDENTITIES"`.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Array of sort objects (e.g.,  [{ fieldName: createdDate, order: Order.ASC }] ).

members.name: extraFields
members.doc: Array of extra post fields to be added in the response.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Array of sort objects (e.g.,  [{ fieldName: createdDate, order: Order.ASC }] ).

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of records that match the filters.

members.name: count
members.doc: Total number of reacted identities count.

members.name: reactionIdentities
members.doc: List of reacted identities grouped by reaction code.

members.name: commentId
members.doc: ID of the "best answer" comment on the post.

members.name: post
members.doc: Post data with partial data to update.

members.name: post
members.doc: Post data with partial data to update.

members.name: postId
members.doc: ID of the post to update.

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.
